citations.narrative:
The facility had a contingency plan that had a written date in 2015 and they did not provide documentation of any annual
reviews. It is important that facilities conduct annual reviews of their contingency plan to ensure that names, locations,
and risk factors have not changed and the plan still adequately addresses emergency actions. Annual reviews must be
documented, as well as changes or amendments to the plan, and documentation must be provided to APHIS during
inspections. Correct by conducting and documenting annual reviews and any amendments to the contingency plan no
later than October 31, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the research compliance officer.
